arts.ttl: 'Man Utd's Malacia eyed by Celtic' - gossip
arts.sum: Manchester United's Tyrell Malacia is linked with Celtic as Leuven reportedly have a bid accepted for St Johnstone striker Benjamin Kimpioka

arts.ttl: World media reacts to Celtic 'redemption' at Aston Villa as Champions League spectacle forces grovelling Rodgers apology
arts.sum: It was a classic Euro night at Villa Park as the Hoops returned north of the border with plenty of credit in the bank

arts.ttl: Celtic can 'make it difficult' for Bayern or Real
arts.sum: Celtic manager Brendan Rodgers is confident his side can "make it difficult" for either Bayern Munich or Real Madrid in the Champions League play-off round, but admits it will be a "huge challenge".

arts.ttl: Adam Idah proved to Celtic dressing room he CAN be next Kyogo as wowed teammate salivates at Jota team up prospect
arts.sum: Celtic lost out in the end but Idah won over a few of his doubters with a double

arts.ttl: Celtic prove to Philippe Clement he doesn’t need a magic stick at Rangers after all but a miracle – Keith Jackson
arts.sum: The Rangers boss made the quip upon being unveiled at Ibrox and the words ring truer to this day than they did then

arts.ttl: Celtic earn huge Champions League prize money windfall after securing knockout playoff spot with mega payday in sight
arts.sum: Europe's elite club competition is also one of the most lucrative for clubs with Celtic making millions

arts.ttl: Celtic show maturity at Villa but smoke bomb puts their fans under a cloud | Ewan Murray
arts.sum: Players showed they are no longer European cannon fodder but supporters’ actions at Villa Park could trigger a ban on them travelling to Madrid or Munich As meaningful Champions League progress arrives, the pity for Celtic’s supporters is that they may be denied the chance to see their team compete in the flesh at that stage. Uefa issued a suspended ban on Celtic selling tickets for an away fixture in Europe in response to the lighting of fireworks during the hammering at Borussia Dortmund. Should Uefa deem a smoke bomb, tossed on to the Villa Park playing surface during celebrations for Adam Idah’s first goal, triggers that sanction then no Celtic fans will travel to Munich or Madrid next month. Ouch. So much depends on the report submitted by Adrian Casha, Uefa’s delegate at this game. Celtic are praying for leniency. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Celtic end group stage with see-saw defeat at Villa
arts.sum: Watch highlights as a hat-trick from Morgan Rogers and twelfth goal of the season from Arsenal target Ollie Watkins lead Aston Villa to a thrilling 4-2 victory over Celtic in the Champions League.

arts.ttl: Unai Emery proud of Aston Villa after ‘brilliant match’ against Celtic
arts.sum: Morgan Rogers and Ollie Watkins starred.

arts.ttl: Celtic fans face Champions League glamour away day BAN for Madrid or Munich as Rodgers bats away flare question
arts.sum: European football's governing body imposed a ban on the Hoops legions which was suspended for two years - and that could be imposed now
